channel.title: Comments on: Stop the ‘Stop Online Piracy’ Act
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.content:encoded:
>>>This is just prohibition all over again in a new digital skin.

I like how you put that Denis, but I hate that it’s probably true.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Stuff like this will just push people towards darknet and freenet. The usage of TOR (The Onion Router) will also increase so that people can bypass these kind of laws

What happened when they shut down Napster?..a million clones became available overnight without centralized servers to shut down.

This is just prohibition all over again in a new digital skin……..

item.title: By: chopstik
item.dc:creator: chopstik
item.content:encoded:
Yeah, this is rather scary. Pretty sure it’s the same thing as here: http://forum.lessthandot.com/viewtopic.php?f=93&t=15654.

Needless to say, it seems more than just a little hypocritical to talk about Chinese censorship when you’re planning to do the same…
